questionText: Quebeckers wanted Bouchard to focus on the economy rather than independence.
author: A2IXBTOWQRCLPZ

questionText: Jean Chretien ruled out any declaration of independence.
author: A2IXBTOWQRCLPZ

questionText: The sentiment for breaking up Canada appeared to gain some momentum in recent years.
author: A2IXBTOWQRCLPZ

questionText: Lucien Bouchard vowed to keep the independence movement alive.
author: A249LDVPG27XCE

questionText: In 1999, Chretien proposed legislation making secession attempts difficult for Quebec.
author: A249LDVPG27XCE

questionText: Lucien Bouchard stepped forward to assume the Premiership and leadership of the Party Quebecois
author: A24DSECWUBZC0Z

questionText: The Quebec Premier Parizeau resigned after defeat in the referendum
author: A24DSECWUBZC0Z

questionText: Bouchard is now in a position to work any attempt to provide changes to his advantage.
author: A2IXBTOWQRCLPZ

questionText: Parti Quebecois retained control in 1998 provincial elections.
author: A249LDVPG27XCE
